result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Roger Davis

defendant.name: Davis, Matthew Roger
defendant.address: 317 S Fillmore St Apt 3, Prairie Du Chien, WI 53821

records.addlTxt: After the 10/17/22 hearing, Attorney Richards advised that he had a time conflict with the Jan. 26, 2023 jury status date and requested the date be moved to Jan. 25, 2023.  JA approved the request and moved all four cases to Jan. 25, 2023 at 9:00 AM by Zoom.
Jury status hearing on January 25, 2023 at 09:00 am.

10:32 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Matthew Roger Davis appeared by phone.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Matthew Roger Davis.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Richards is heard. Waives reading of the information. Defendant entered pleas of Not Guilty, clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count in each case. 

22CF48 Defendant plead not guilty  
22CF114 Defendant plead not guilty 
22CF128  Defendant plead not guilty 
22CF146  Defendant plead not guilty
Jury status hearing scheduled for January 26, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Jury status hearing on January 26, 2023 at 10:00 am.

11:40 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Matthew Roger Davis in court.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Matthew Roger Davis.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Adjourn to track along with the other cases.
Jury status hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Jury status hearing on October 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

9:52 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Matthew Roger Davis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court will immediately release defendant. Court cancels warrant.

9:28 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Matthew Roger Davis not in court.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Matthew Roger Davis.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Richards is heard on the appearance of the defendant. 
State requests a warrant. Prepare a warrant and hold until the Oct 5th date. 
Court will authorize a warrant, will not sign it until the Oct 5th appearance date in the event that the defendant appears that day.

11:00 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Matthew Roger Davis appeared by phone.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Matthew Roger Davis.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Richards is heard. 

Court reviews preliminary questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. Atty Richards is heard and they are ready to proceed with an arraignment. 

Atty Richards is heard and waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.
Jury status hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on September 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:01 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Matthew Roger Davis in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Steven Richards appears via video for Def. Matthew Davis.
     Court reviews complaint with defendant.  Def. states understanding.
     Court concludes at 11:06 a.m.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:21 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Matthew Roger Davis appeared by video, Attorney Luke Steiner for State of Wisconsin appeared by video. 

Court finds probable cause.

DA is heard on bond. Requests a $150.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Prohibits any driving without being duly reinstated. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $150.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Prohibits any driving without being duly reinstated with a valid DL. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
